reviews.review_text: I was looking for a book to read about urban Brazilian culture and ran across this book on some publisher's "Top 10" Brazilian reads list. I found it to be a very engaging, well-written book with multiple characters and storylines that mesh together artfully, without running to hundreds of pages. Great, short read.

title: Bahia Blues
word_cloud: look urban brazilian culture run publisher read list find engage multiple character story lines mesh together artfully run hundred page short
summary: The sleepy town of Bahia slowly withers as, one by one, its children abandon the town to follow their fortunes in the big cities of southern Brazil. Once there, they discover the rampant violence and squalor of Rio de Janeiro's shantytowns, the lively streets of Sao Paolo, and the despair within Bahia's prison, Canju.
story_arc: Opens with good fortunes, but doomed to fail
